item.title: Senate Health Care Debate To Dismantle Obamacare Continues
item.description: July 26, 2017 - The Senate has another day of debate on healthcare. Tuesday a repeal and replace proposal fell short of the votes needed to pass and on Wednesday, lawmakers will take a vote on a repeal only option.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 26, 2017 - The Senate has another day of debate on healthcare. Tuesday a repeal and replace proposal fell short of the votes needed to pass and on Wednesday, lawmakers will take a vote on a repeal only option. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/26/539576114/senate-health-care-debate-to-dismantle-obamacare-enters-day-2

item.title: Hospitals Face Growing Cybersecurity Threats
item.description: July 26, 2017 - Cyberattacks and data breaches are common at health care facilities, and they can put patients' health at risk. Hospitals are behind the curve in beefing up defenses, industry analysts say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 26, 2017 - Cyberattacks and data breaches are common at health care facilities, and they can put patients' health at risk. Hospitals are behind the curve in beefing up defenses, industry analysts say. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/26/539290596/hospitals-face-growing-cybersecurity-threats

item.title: Arepas Are Conquering The World â€“ But Dying At Home In Venezuela
item.description: July 26, 2017 - For Venezuelans, the stuffed corn-meal cakes have long been the daily bread of life. Yet even as arepas are embraced from New York to Barcelona, they are disappearing in their hunger-wracked homeland.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 26, 2017 - For Venezuelans, the stuffed corn-meal cakes have long been the daily bread of life. Yet even as arepas are embraced from New York to Barcelona, they are disappearing in their hunger-wracked homeland. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/07/26/538515889/arepas-are-conquering-the-world-but-dying-at-home-in-venezuela

item.title: The GOP Tries Again On Health Care
item.description:
July 26, 2017 - Senate Republicans have voted to begin proceedings on a new healthcare plan.

item.title: New Abortion Restrictions Head To Missouri Governor's Office
item.description: July 26, 2017 - "Today is a great victory for pregnancy care centers," Gov. Eric Greitens said after lawmakers approved the legislation.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Student Athletes Who Specialize Early Are Injured More Often, Study Finds
item.description: July 25, 2017 - High school athletes who tended to focus on one sport were 50 percent more likely to get hurt than those who hadn't specialized. Injuries included ankle sprains, knee tendonitis, and stress fractures.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - High school athletes who tended to focus on one sport were 50 percent more likely to get hurt than those who hadn't specialized. Injuries included ankle sprains, knee tendonitis, and stress fractures. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/25/539334374/student-athletes-who-specialize-early-are-injured-more-often-study-finds

item.title: New Report Shows 64 Of 195 Countries Aren't Meeting A Basic Vaccination Target
item.description: July 25, 2017 - The goal is to reach 90 percent of children with the DTP vaccination â€” a child's first scheduled immunization. Some countries are barely at 50 percent.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - The goal is to reach 90 percent of children with the DTP vaccination â€” a child's first scheduled immunization. Some countries are barely at 50 percent. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/25/538539473/new-report-shows-64-of-195-countries-arent-meeting-basic-vaccination-target

item.title: Senators Vote To Proceed With Health Care Debate
item.description:
July 25, 2017 - Tuesday's vote was on a procedural step that opens the door to formal debate â€” but on what remains to be seen.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/07/25/539270923/senators-to-vote-on-whether-to-proceed-with-health-care-debate

item.title: New Hope For HIV Treatment?
item.description: July 25, 2017 - A case study on a girl in South Africa could provide the key to new ways of treating HIV. She is the latest of one of three childhood cases of the virus that have gone into extended remission. What does this mean for the future of treatment?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - A case study on a girl in South Africa could provide the key to new ways of treating HIV. She is the latest of one of three childhood cases of the virus that have gone into extended remission. What does this mean for the future of treatment? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-07-25/new-hope-for-hiv-treatment

item.title: Study: CTE Found In Nearly All Donated NFL Player Brains
item.description: July 25, 2017 - As the country starts to get back into its most popular professional team sport, this serves as a reminder of how dangerous football can be.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - As the country starts to get back into its most popular professional team sport, this serves as a reminder of how dangerous football can be. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/25/539198429/study-cte-found-in-nearly-all-donated-nfl-player-brains

item.title: What Are The Planet's Real 'Talking' Chimps And Gorillas Saying?
item.description: July 25, 2017 - Movies are full of loquacious chimps, but could nonhuman apes really use language? NPR's Skunk Bear sorts through the disturbing history of research on ape language to sort fact from wishful thinking.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - Movies are full of loquacious chimps, but could nonhuman apes really use language? NPR's Skunk Bear sorts through the disturbing history of research on ape language to sort fact from wishful thinking. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/25/538580495/what-are-the-planet-s-real-talking-chimps-and-gorillas-saying

item.title: Study: Memphis Support Program For New Moms Especially Helps Boys
item.description: July 24, 2017 - Nurse-Family Partnership programs provide low-income mothers with checkups. Robert Siegel speaks with Nobel Laureate James Heckman on the benefits of NFP, which is found to especially help boys.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - Nurse-Family Partnership programs provide low-income mothers with checkups. Robert Siegel speaks with Nobel Laureate James Heckman on the benefits of NFP, which is found to especially help boys. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/24/539087970/study-memphis-support-program-for-new-moms-especially-helps-boys

item.title: The Senate Health Care Vote, Simplified
item.description: July 24, 2017 - President Trump is pushing the Senate to repeal and replace Obamacare this week. But with multiple bills in play, it's far from clear what the Senate would vote on. Here's a recap of the options.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - President Trump is pushing the Senate to repeal and replace Obamacare this week. But with multiple bills in play, it's far from clear what the Senate would vote on. Here's a recap of the options. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/24/539051768/the-senate-health-care-vote-simplified

item.title: How Crisis Pregnancy Center Clients Rely On Medicaid
item.description: July 24, 2017 - Medicaid pays for nearly half the births in the U.S., and centers that counsel women against abortion often help pregnant women enroll in Medicaid so they don't have to worry about health care costs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - Medicaid pays for nearly half the births in the U.S., and centers that counsel women against abortion often help pregnant women enroll in Medicaid so they don't have to worry about health care costs. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/24/538556088/crisis-pregnancy-centers-help-pregnant-women-enroll-in-medicaid

item.title: Parents Of Terminally Ill British Baby Charlie Gard End Legal Fight
item.description: July 24, 2017 - The couple's lawyer told the London High Court that new medical tests have shown that an experimental treatment would not help at this point, ending their legal fight to transport him to the U.S.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
